gw.cc.claim

Class NewClaimPolicyDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.cc.claim.NewClaimPolicyDescription

  • public class NewClaimPolicyDescription
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes a policy that is to be added to a claim. The user specifies this description via the NewClaimPolicyValueWidget and the NewClaimPolicy class uses it to create a new policy. This is a very simple object, really just a convenient way to bundle up several related variables. The only tricky parts are:
    1. the "verified policy loss date" field. This field is automatically unset whenever the verified policy number is set, and must be explicitly set afterwards if the verified policy number was set via a pick operation. This is awkward, but fits the way the widget uses these fields.
    2. the "is changed" flag. This flag is automatically set if the policy number or type is changed. It does not, at the moment track if the "policy verified" flag changes. For the description to really change the number or type must change, so the UI only warns if the user tries to change these
    Author:
    tmorris

      • setForcePolicyReset

        public void setForcePolicyReset(boolean forceReset)
        Setting this to true will force all subsequent calls to NewClaimPolicy.setPolicy() to reset the policy on the claim. Use with caution.
        Parameters:
        forceReset - True if it is desired to force a policy on the claim to reset during the FNOL wizard.
